moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4 d6: the slow version, of the Sicilian: against this, only g6 stands a chance...
moves.3. Nf3 Nc6 4. c3: a profylactic measure against Nb4/Nd4: also part of the Grand Prix Attack approach; the only feasable weapon against any Sicilian...
moves.4... g6 5. g3 Bg7 6. Bg2: this also goes with the territory: fianchetto's on the Kings' wing; Indian style...
moves.6... e6: preparing Ne7: Nf6 has no place in this opening...
moves.7. d3: usually played against Nf6, if or when it occurs: but also this serves a common purpose...
moves.7... Nge7 8. Be3: Black is preparing castling: White can wait a while...
moves.8... O-O 9. Nbd2: not making any decisions yet: just developing...
moves.9... b5: not bad: conquering the Queens' wing, might work out profitable later...
moves.10. Qc2: here, White can still decide wheter to castle short or long: or never at all; Kf2 is a safe place...
moves.10... a5 11. Kf2 Bb7: already, Black is at least two tempi behind in development: he still needs to find purpose for the Queen...
moves.12. Rhd1: preparing d4: the enevitable outcome of any Sicilian...
moves.12... Qc7: not unwise: get the Queen off the d-file; also completing development...
moves.13. Rac1: still more preparation for d4: in fact, a hidden attack on Qc7...
moves.13... e5: probably better than Rc8: but not discouraging d4...
moves.14. d4 exd4: keeping the c-file closed, forcing White: Be3 is trapped...
moves.15. cxd4 cxd4 16. Nxd4: also forced: leaving Nd4 attacked twice, covered only by Be3, while developing Bg7; this gives Black time for Rc8...
moves.16... Rfc8 17. Nd2f3: also forced: the stage is set...
moves.18. Nxc6 Qxc6: a sound solution for now: up to a certain point...
moves.19. Qd3 Qd7: sacrificing d6, but b2 and e4 are attacked too...
moves.20. e5: killing two birds, with one stone: the Black Queen is again uncovered...
moves.20... d5: this looks like a solution: but it is not...
moves.21... b4: Bc6 will not work: this might...
moves.22. Qb5: wrapping it up: the Black Queen is uncovered, and cannot leave Bb7...
moves.26... Rxb5: there is no use, in running from this with Qxa2: Rxc8+ is too dangerous...
moves.27... Rxc6 28. Bxc6: very clever: Rb5 has no way out...
